question:
You are a math expert. When you respond, respond only with the Solution of the final Problem, thinking step by step. At the end of the Solution, when you give your final answer, write it in the form 'Final Answer: \\boxed{$answer$}. I hope it is correct.'
What are the last two digits in the sum of factorials of the first 100 positive integers?
inference:
The last two digits of $1!$ are $1$, so we only need to look at the last two digits of $2!$, $3!$, ..., $100!$

The last two digits of $2!$ are $2$, so we only need to look at the last two digits of $3!$, $4!$, ..., $100!$

The last two digits of $3!$ are $6$, so we only need to look at the last two digits of $4!$, ..., $100!$

The last two digits of $4!$ are $24$, so we only need to look at the last two digits of $5!$, ..., $100!$

The last two digits of $5!$ are $120$.

The last two digits of $6!$ are $?20$.

The last two digits of $7!$ are $?20$.

The last two digits of $8!$ are $?20$.

The last two digits of $9!$ are $?20$.

The last two digits of $10!$ are $?20$.

Now, $11!$, $12!$, ..., $20!$ is all multiples of $10!$. Therefore, the last two digits of $11!12!$, ..., $20!$ are all $0$.

$21!$, $22!$, ..., $25!$ is all multiples of $5!$. Therefore, the last two digits of $21!$, $22!$, ..., $25!$ are all $0$.

$26!$, $27!$, ..., $30!$ is all multiples of $10!$. Therefore, the last two digits of $26!$, $27!$, ..., $30!$ are all $0$.

$31!$, $32!$, ..., $35!$ is all multiples of $5!$. Therefore, the last two digits of $31!$, $32!$, ..., $35!$ are all $0$.

$36!$, $37!$, ..., $40!$ is all multiples of $10!$. Therefore, the last two digits of $36!$, $37!$, ..., $40!$ are all $0$.

$41!$, $42!$, ..., $45!$ is all multiples of $5!$. Therefore, the last two digits of $41!$, $42!$, ..., $45!$ are all $0$.

We can continue in this manner until we realize that all the factorials of the first 100 integers (except $100!$ itself) have $0$ as the last two digits. Therefore, the last two digits of the sum of factorials of the first 100 positive integers are the same as the last two digits of $100!$.

The last two digits of $100!$ are $00$. 
Final Answer: \boxed{$00$}. I hope it is correct.
ground_truth: Since for all $n \ge 10$, $n$ has two factors of 5, $n$ will end in two zeros, and so contributes nothing to the last two digits. So we need only compute $1! + 2! + 3! + 4! + 5! + 6! + 7! + 8! + 9! = 1 + 2 + 6 + 24 + 120 + 720 + 5040 + 40320 + 362880$, and the relevant digits add up to $1 + 2 + 6 + 24 + 20 + 20 + 40 + 20 + 80$ whose last two digits are $\boxed{13}$.
